724885f-a.text:
York Avenue (Avenue A), west side, from o7th to 68th Streets, showing a skating rink and the old cigar factory, on the S.W. corner of 68th Street, where Robt. Burns cigars used to be made. It was built around 1905, and now belongs to Seicenberg and Company. It is shortly to be cemolished, and around the same time the rink will be
converted into tennis courts.
As late as 1902 these plots were occupied by a stone yard, probably belonging to the B. & G. Williams stone yard across the Avenue.
February 13, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

724883f-a.text:
Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, York Avenue, east side, at o7th Street. The new laboratory is nearing completion. Its south aide is in line with o7th Street, which was permanently closed (about 1926) east of York Avenue. In the right foreground is shown part of the old playground which used to occupy the block from 67th to o8th Streets. The construction beginning at the extreme left of this picture is on the north side of 68th Street.
Juiy 31, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

724884f-a.text:
York Avenue, east side, from 67th to o8th Streets, showing the playground of the Lenox Hill Neighborhood Association, with a new laboratory building under construction for the Rockefeller Institute, in the right background, and the new New York Hospital and Cornell Medical College under construction on the north side of 68th Street. This playground, which is now about to give way to tennis courts, has occupied this site since around 1920; around 1885 to 1905
this was the stone yard of B. A. & G. N. W. Williams.
July 31, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

724886f-a.text:
york Avenue, east side, from o7th to 71st Streets, showing construction of New York Hospital and Cornell Medical Center, and playground of Lenox Hill Neighborhood Association, on S.E. corner of 68th Street,
which is shortly to be made over into tennis courts.
July 31, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

714198f-a.text:
67th Street, north side, between York and First Aves., showing s general view northeast. Prominent buildings shown are the New York
Hospital and Cornell Medical College.
June 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

724897f-a.text:
York avenue, (fornerly Avenue "A"), west side, south from E. b9th to o7th Streets, showing prominently the ne. Memorial Hospital for the Treatment of Cancer and
Allied Diseases.
This structure occupys the block,west from this thoroughfare to First Avenue, between 67th and 68th Streets. At the right are tennis courts between 68th and 69th Streets. To tne left are apartment houses at
the S.N. corner of o7th Street.
November 13, 1939
gqift of George Jiranek
New York Public Library
Photostat Bivision
